column4: then just create a user for testing, so as not to break your regular account
Oh good point. Would setting up a different user make it so that different user would have a totally different environment?
all non system settings being stored per user in dotted dirs, as long as you don't mess with system files, you're safe :)
with this one user can easily run kde and the other one gnome
I see. so as long as I don't mess with /etc, /var... as long as I stick with messing with stuff in ~ I should be alright?
Very helpful tip.Looks like I'll break open another user account
you can even set up some session handling via .xininitrc or /etc/X11/Sessions, so that one can select the DM started on login
.xinitrc is the file called on when you run startx from a VT, or it can be started by gdm/kdm/xdm
I see. slocate shows that's in etc/X11/xinit right?
that's the default one, when~/.xinitrc is not present
If I were to touch .xinitrc and leave it blank, would that cause gdm to just go "wtf" and not load up my desktop manager?
totally. gdm would execute nothing but oblivin, and then return back to gdm
Alright. I won't touch that then until I read up some docs about it lol
good attitude :) , you will mainly want to understand the 'exec' keyword inside this file.
now I'll wish you good luck in your tweaking ventures ;)
Thanks very much :) Your information will be very helpful
